official_title: A bill to require Federal employees to file with the Office of the Federal Register a statement with respect to certain gifts made or received by such employees.

summary.text: Federal Employees Gift Disclosure Act - Directs Federal employees to file statements with the Office of the Federal Register annually regarding the making of gifts exceeding $500 to another Federal employee or to a State or local officer or employee, and the reception of gifts of such amount from any individual source. Requires the annual publication of the statements filed under this Act. Provides for a penality for violation of this Act in the amount of not more than a $5,000 fine, or imprisonment for not less than one year, or both.

titles.title: A bill to require Federal employees to file with the Office of the Federal Register a statement with respect to certain gifts made or received by such employees.
